text.div:
version: 1

title: Surgical Site Infection Questionnaire

status: DRAFT

code: Healthcare Associated Infection Report Document (Details: LOINC code 51897-7 = 'Healthcare Associated Infection report Document', stated as 'Healthcare Associated Infection Report Document')

subjectType: Patient

item

linkId: patient

text: Patient

type: REFERENCE

required: true

item

linkId: date-of-event

text: Date of Event

note: Date of infection event

type: DATE

required: true

item

linkId: nhsn-procedure-code

text: NHSN Procedure Code

note: NHSN code of procedure performed.

type: CHOICE

required: true

options: NHSNProcedureCategoryCode url: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/hai/ValueSet/nhsn-procedure-category-code; name: NHSNProcedureCategoryCode; ACTIVE; description: Code System: cdcNHSN 2.16.840.1.113883.6.277
NHSN's value set for the clinical statement recording procedure details in SSI, CLIP, and Procedure Reports.

item

linkId: icd-procedure-code

text: ICD-10-PCS or CPT Procedure Code

note: ICD-10-PCS or CPT code of procedure performed.

type: CHOICE

required: true

options: ICD-10-PCS

item

linkId: date-of-procedure

text: Date of Procedure

note: Date of the procedure.

type: DATE

required: true

item

linkId: outpatient-procedure

text: Outpatient Procedure

note: Whether the procedure was outpatient or inpatient.

type: CHOICE

required: true

repeats: false

options: nhsn-encounter-type-code. Generated Summary: url: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/hai/ValueSet/nhsn-encounter-type-code; name: NHSNEncounterTypeCode; ACTIVE; description: Code System: HL7 ActCode 2.16.840.1.113883.5.4

item

linkId: mdro-infection-surveillance

text: MDRO Infection Surveillance

note: Whether the primary infection being reported was caused by a multi-drug-resistant organism (MDRO).

type: BOOLEAN

required: true

item

linkId: date-admitted-to-facility

text: Date Admitted to Facility:

note: The date the patient was admitted to the facility.

type: DATE

required: true

item

linkId: location-code

text: Location Code

note: Code for the type of location.

type: CHOICE

required: false

options: NHSNHealthcareServiceLocationCode. Generated Summary: url: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/hai/ValueSet/nhsn-healthcare-service-location-code; name: NHSNHealthcareServiceLocationCode; ACTIVE; description: A classification of patient care locations within healthcare facilities for public health surveillance purposes.

item

linkId: specific-event

text: Specific Event

note: The infection condition being reported.

type: CHOICE

required: true

options: NHSNInfectionConditionCode. Generated Summary: url: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/hai/ValueSet/nhsn-infection-condition-code; name: NHSNInfectionConditionCode; ACTIVE; description: Code System: SNOMED CT 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96 or cdcNHSN 2.16.840.1.113883.6.277

item

linkId: infection-present-at-time-of-surgery

code: Infection present at the time of surgery (Details: SNOMED CT code 1237-7 = '1237-7', stated as 'Infection present at the time of surgery')

text: Infection Present at Time of Surgery (PATOS)

note: Whether or not an infection was present at the time that a surgical procedure was performed.

type: BOOLEAN

required: true

item

linkId: criteria-used

text: Specify Criteria Used (check all that apply)

note: Criterion used in the diagnosis of the infection type or the identification of an adverse reaction.

type: CHOICE

required: true

repeats: true

options: NHSNCriterionOfDiagnosisCode. Generated Summary: url: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/hai/ValueSet/nhsn-criterion-of-diagnosis-code; name: NHSNCriterionOfDiagnosisCode; ACTIVE; description: Code System: SNOMED CT 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96 or cdcNHSN 2.16.840.1.113883.6.277

item

linkId: when-detected

text: When Detected

note: When, in relation to an admission (a surgery stay), an HAI was detected.

type: CHOICE

required: true

options: NHSNOccasionOfDetectionCode. Generated Summary: url: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/hai/ValueSet/nhsn-occasion-of-detection; name: NHSNOccasionOfDetectionCode; ACTIVE; description: Code System: cdcNHSN 2.16.840.1.113883.6.277

item

linkId: secondary-bsi

code: Secondary bloodstream infection (Details: urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.277 code 3111-2 = '3111-2', stated as 'Secondary bloodstream infection')

text: Secondary Bloodstream Infection

note: Whether a secondary bloodstream infection was present

type: BOOLEAN

required: true

item

linkId: died

code: Dead (Details: SNOMED CT code 419099009 = 'Dead (finding)', stated as 'Dead')

text: Died

note: Whether the patient died.

type: BOOLEAN

required: true

item

linkId: ssi-contributed-to-death

text: SSI Contributed to Death

note: If the patient died, whether the infection being recorded contributed to that death.

type: BOOLEAN

enable item when:

- Question HasAnswer
* died true

required: false

item

linkId: date-discharged-from-facility

text: Date Discharged From Facility:

note: The date the patient was discharged from the facility.

type: DATE

required: false

item

linkId: pathogens-identified

text: Pathogens Identified

note: Whether pathogens were identified.

type: BOOLEAN

required: true

item

linkId: findings-group

text: Findings Group

note: Group containing items about any pathogen(s) that was/were identified.

type: GROUP

enable item when:

- Question HasAnswer
* pathogens-identified true

required: false

repeats: true

item

linkId: pathogen-identified

text: Pathogen Identified

note: A code representing a pathogen that was identified. Eg.: Staphylococcus coagulase-negative

type: CHOICE

required: true

options: NHSNPathogenCode. Generated Summary: url: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/hai/ValueSet/nhsn-pathogen-code; name: NHSNPathogenCode; ACTIVE

item

linkId: pathogen-ranking

text: Pathogen Ranking

note: Up to three pathogens can be recorded. This item records the relative importance of a pathogen in that set with respect to its role in the infection.

type: CHOICE

required: true

options: NHSNPathogenRanking. Generated Summary: url: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/hai/ValueSet/nhsn-pathogen-ranking; name: NHSNPathogenRanking; ACTIVE

item

linkId: drug-susceptibility-test-group

text: Drug Susceptibility Test Group

note: This group contains two items and uses two codes: one to identify the drug and the other to record the pathogen’s susceptibility to it. A LOINC code represents a methodless isolate drug-susceptibility test; an HL7 ObservationInterpretation code represents the susceptibility finding.

type: GROUP

required: false

item

linkId: drug-susceptibility-test

text: Drug Susceptibility Test

note: The drug that was used to test the pathogen's susceptibility. A LOINC code represents a methodless isolate drug-susceptibility test Eg.: DAPTO

type: CHOICE

required: true

options: NHSNDrugSusceptibilityTestsCode. Generated Summary: url: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/hai/ValueSet/nhsn-drug-susceptibility-tests-code; name: NHSNDrugSusceptibilityTestsCode; ACTIVE

item

linkId: drug-susceptibility-finding

text: Drug Susceptibility Finding

note: The pathogen’s susceptibility to the drug. An HL7 ObservationInterpretation code represents the susceptibility finding. Eg.: S, NS, or N

type: CHOICE

required: true

options: NHSNDrugSusceptibilityFindingCode. Generated Summary: url: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/hai/ValueSet/nhsn-drug-susceptibility-finding-code; name: NHSNDrugSusceptibilityFindingCode; ACTIVE

contained.name: NHSNProcedureCategoryCode
contained.description:
Code System: cdcNHSN 2.16.840.1.113883.6.277

NHSN's value set for the clinical statement recording procedure details in SSI, CLIP, and Procedure Reports.                                                

The full table is shown in the hai_voc.xls file provided with this package.

concept.display: Bile duct, liver or pancreatic surgery
Coronary artery bypass graft with both chest and donor site incisions
Coronary artery bypass graft with chest incision only

contained.name: NHSNPathogenCode
contained.description:
Code System: SNOMED CT 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96 or cdcNHSN 2.16.840.1.113883.6.277

A full listing of codes can be found in the hai_voc.xls file provided with this package.

contained.name: NHSNDrugSusceptibilityTestsCode
contained.description:
Code System: LOINC 2.16.840.1.113883.6.1 or cdcNHSN 2.16.840.1.113883.6.277

A full listing of codes can be found in the hai_voc.xls file provided with this package.

contained.name: NHSNDrugSusceptibilityFindingCode
contained.description:
Code System: HL7ObservationInterpretation 2.16.840.1.113883.5.83

A full listing of codes can be found in the hai_voc.xls file provided with this package.

contained.name: NHSNHealthcareServiceLocationCode
contained.description:
A classification of patient care locations within healthcare facilities for public health surveillance purposes.

A full listing of codes can be found in the hai_voc.xls file provided with this package.

concept.display: Inpatient Pediatric Ear, Nose, Throat Ward
LTCF Skilled Nursing/Short Term Rehabilitation Unit
Outpatient Surgery Recovery Room/Post-Anesthesia Care Unit
ONC Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplant Ward
Inpatient Pediatric Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplant Oncology Ward

contained.name: NHSNPathogenRanking
contained.description: Ordinal rankings for the relative importance of a pathogen in that set with respect to its role in the infection.

contained.name: NHSNEncounterTypeCode
contained.description:
Code System: HL7 ActCode  2.16.840.1.113883.5.4

A full listing of codes can be found in the hai_voc.xls file provided with this package.

contained.name: NHSNInfectionConditionCode
contained.description:
Code System: SNOMED CT 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96 or cdcNHSN 2.16.840.1.113883.6.277

A full listing of codes can be found in the hai_voc.xls file provided with this package.

concept.display: Ear or mastoid infection (otitis externa, otitis media, otitis interna, mastoiditis)
Gastrointestinal tract infection (esophagus, stomach, small and large bowel, and rectum) excluding gastroenteritis and appendicitis

Intraabdominal infection, not specified elsewhere including gallbladder, bile ducts, liver (excluding viral hepatitis), spleen, pancreas, peritoneum, subphrenic or subdiaphragmatic space, or other intraabdominal tissue or area not specified elsewhere
Intracranial infection (brain abscess, subdural or epidural infection, encephalitis)
Other infections of the lower respiratory tract, other than pneumonia
Oral cavity infection (mouth, tongue, or gums)
Other infections of the male or female reproductive tract (epididymis, testes, prostate, vagina, ovaries, uterus, or other deep pelvic tissues, excluding endometritis or vaginal cuff infections)
Other infections of the urinary tract (kidney, ureter, bladder, urethra, or tissue surrounding the retroperitoneal or perinephric space)
Upper respiratory tract infection, pharyngitis, laryngitis, epiglottitis
Soft tissue, muscle, lymph node, or salivary gland

contained.name: NHSNCriterionOfDiagnosisCode
contained.description:
Code System: SNOMED CT 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96 or cdcNHSN 2.16.840.1.113883.6.277

A full listing of codes can be found in the hai_voc.xls file provided with this package.

concept.display: Positive culture from greater than or equal to two separate tissue or fluid samples from affected joint
Blood culture not done or no organisms detected in blood
>=2 positive cultures with >=10^2 col/ml of same uropathogen from nonvoided specimen
>=2 positive urine cultures with >=10^5 col/cc with no more than 2 organisms
>15 colonies cultured from IV cannula tip using semiquantitative culture method
1 positive culture with >=10^5 col/cc with no more than 2 organisms
1 positive culture with >=103 CFU/ml and <105 CFU/ml with no more than 2 species of microorganisms
1 positive culture with <=10^5 col/ml of a single uropathogen in patient being treated with an effective antimicrobial agent for UTI
4-fold rise in L. pneumophila antibody titer
4-fold rise in paired sera for pathogen
Common skin contaminant from >2 blood cultures (see NHSN protocol for definition of skin contaminant)
L pneumophila serogroup 1 antigens in urine
Matching positive blood and sputum cultures w/ Candida spp
Positive culture of virus or Chlamydia
Positive culture or micro-IF of Legionella spp
Positive detection of viral antigen or antibody
Positive dipstick for leukocyte esterase or nitrate
Positive Gram stain when culture is negative or not done
Positive PCR for Chlamydia or Mycoplasma
Positive quantitative culture from LRT specimen
Recognized pathogen from one or more blood cultures
Acute onset of diarrhea (liquid stools for > 12 hours)
Apnea, tachycardia, nasal flaring with retraction of chest wall or grunting
Fungi or Pneumocytis carinii from LRT specimen
Histopathologic exam w/ abscess formation, positive quantitative culture of lung parenchyma, or positive quantitative culture of lung parenchyma, or lung parenchyma invasion by fungal hyphae
Incision deliberately opened or otherwise drained by physician
New onset/change in sputum, increased secretions   or increased suctioning
New or progressive and persistent infiltrate
Other evidence of infection found on direct exam, during surgery, or by diagnostic tests
Persistent microscopic or gross blood in stools
Physician diagnosis of this event type
Wound (not related to vascular access) with pus or increased redness
Acute pain, swelling, or tenderness of testes, epididymis, or prostate
Criterion 1 - Positive culture from Endotracheal aspirate without purulent respiratory secretions
Criterion 1 - Positive culture from Bronchoalveolar lavage without purulent respiratory secretions
Criterion 1 - Positive culture from Lung tissue without purulent respiratory secretions
Criterion 1 - Positive culture from Protected specimen brush without purulent respiratory secretions
Criterion 2 - Purulent respiratory secretions plus organism(s)
Criterion 2 - Organisms from Sputum cluture with purulent respiratory secretions
Criterion 2 - Organisms from Endotracheal aspirate culture with purulent respiratory secretions
Criterion 2 - Organisms from Bronchoalveolar lavage culture with purulent respiratory secretions
Criterion 2 - Organisms from Lung tissue culture with purulent respiratory secretions
Criterion 2 - Organisms from Protected specimen brush culture with purulent respiratory secretions
Criterion 3 - Positive test Organism(s) identified from pleural fluid
Criterion 3 - Positive test for Lung histopathology
Criterion 3 - Positive Diagnostic test for Legionella species
Criterion 3 - Positive Diagnostic test for selected viral pathogens
Daily min FiO2 increase > 0.20 (20 points) for > 2 days
Daily min PEEP increase > 3 cm H2O for > 2 days
White blood cell count >= 12,000 or <= 4,000 cells/mm3
A new antimicrobial agent(s) is started, and is continued for >= 4 days

contained.name: NHSNOccasionOfDetectionCode
contained.description:
Code System: cdcNHSN 2.16.840.1.113883.6.277

A full listing of codes can be found in the hai_voc.xls file provided with this package.

concept.display: Admission (during the stay in which the surgery was performed)
Readmission to facility where associated procedure performed
Readmission to facility other than where the associated procedure was performed

extension.valueString: Date of infection event
NHSN code of procedure performed.
ICD-10-PCS or CPT code of procedure performed.
Date of the procedure.
Whether the procedure was outpatient or inpatient.
Whether the primary infection being reported was caused by a multi-drug-resistant organism (MDRO).
The date the patient was admitted to the facility.
Code for the type of location.
The infection condition being reported.
Whether or not an infection was present at the time that a surgical procedure was performed.

code.display: Infection present at the time of surgery

item.text: Infection Present at Time of Surgery (PATOS)

extension.valueString: Criterion used in the diagnosis of the infection type or the identification of an adverse reaction.

item.text: Specify Criteria Used (check all that apply)

extension.valueString: When, in relation to an admission (a surgery stay), an HAI was detected.
Whether a secondary bloodstream infection was present
Whether the patient died.
If the patient died, whether the infection being recorded contributed to that death.
The date the patient was discharged from the facility.
Whether pathogens were identified.
Group containing items about any pathogen(s) that was/were identified.
A code representing a pathogen that was identified. Eg.: Staphylococcus coagulase-negative
Up to three pathogens can be recorded. This item records the relative importance of a pathogen in that set with respect to its role in the infection.

This group contains two items and uses two codes: one to identify the drug and the other to record the pathogen’s susceptibility to it. A LOINC code represents a methodless isolate drug-susceptibility test; an HL7 ObservationInterpretation code represents the susceptibility finding.
The drug that was used to test the pathogen's susceptibility. A LOINC code represents a methodless isolate drug-susceptibility test Eg.: DAPTO
The pathogen’s susceptibility to the drug. An HL7 ObservationInterpretation code represents the susceptibility finding. Eg.: S, NS, or N
